Welcome to RT_2_Assignment_1’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

user_interface Module¶

This is the user interface that prints a prompt message of a number of action that can be performed by the user and then set the state of the node base on the response gotten from the user

–Publishes to:¶

/cmd_vel used to stop the motion of the robot on request of the user

–Service:¶

/movebase_client request the movebase client node to move the robot to target location with the movebase action server /movebase_result request the movebase result service to wait until the robot has reached the goal target.

scripts.user_interface.call_bug_algo(target)[source]¶

This function calls the node for the bug0 algorithm, it is called when the user switches to bug0 algorithm. It sends a target position to the bug0 node by the way of ros parameter server and receives a response of status message

Parameters

  • target (MoveBaseTarget) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

Returns

A string containing a response message sent from the server.

Return type

[string]

scripts.user_interface.call_movebase(target)[source]¶

This function takes in a target position and sends it as a request to a service called movebase client, this service communicates with the movebase action server to perform path planning task for moving the robot from the current position to the target position.

Parameters

  • target (MoveBaseTarget) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

Returns

A string containing a response message sent from the server.

Return type

[string]

scripts.user_interface.check_location(x, y)[source]¶

This function checks to see if the location selected by the user is one of the locations contained in posible target position list

Parameters

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the selected position

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the selected position

Returns

The function returns True if the position selected is in the posible target position list, and False if it is not in the list.

Return type

[bool]

scripts.user_interface.main()[source]¶

The main function for initializing the node an calling each of the node functions based on the input from the user. The main function makes use of state value to select the appropriate function for the required task

scripts.user_interface.wait_for_result()[source]¶

This function sends a request to a movebase result server to wait until the target had been reached before send a response of target reached.

Returns

A string containing a response message “Target Reached”.

Return type

[string]

movebase_client Module¶

This node is a client that accept some target from the user interface and then send the target as a goal to the movebase action server

Subscribes to:

/movebase_action_feedback topic where the movebase action sends a feedback of the current position of the robot

Service:

/movebase_client a server that gets the required target position from the user interface /movebase_result a server that waits until the goal has been successful and then sends a response of “Target Reached” to the user interface client

scripts.movebase_client.check_target(target)[source]¶

This function check to see if the robot is not already in the new target that is received.

Parameters

  • target (MoveBaseTarget) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

Returns

The function returns True if the robot is already at the new target received and returns False if the robot is not at the new target received.

Return type

[bool]

scripts.movebase_client.feedback_callback(pose_message)[source]¶

The pose callback function takes the position and posture of the robot from the argument “pose_message” and set it to two global variables containing the x and y coordinates pose.

Parameters

  • pose_message (Odom) – an object containing all the values

  • robot (of the current position and posture of the) –

scripts.movebase_client.handle_result(mes)[source]¶

This is a callback function for a service for waiting for the result from the movebase action server.

Parameters

mes (string) – Containing a string message from the client that called this service

Returns

Send a response of status message “Target Reached” to the client when state is set to SUCCEEDED by the movebase action.

Return type

[MoveBaseResultResponse]

scripts.movebase_client.handle_target(mes)[source]¶

This function is a callback function for the movebase client that sets the state to 1 which means active (start goal)

Parameters

  • mes (MoveBaseTarget) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

Returns

Sends a response status message to the client that called the service

Return type

[MoveBaseTargetResponse]

scripts.movebase_client.movebase_client(client, target)[source]¶

This function is responsible for calling the movebase action server to send the goal target and set some necessary parameter for the movebase action.

Parameters

  • client (Object) – Object for linking to the Initialize movebase action server

  • target (MoveBaseTarget) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

scripts.movebase_client.the_distance_to_target(target)[source]¶

Calculate the distance between the position of the robot and the target position

Parameters

  • ( (target) –

  • Target) – This is a custom ROS message containing an x and y

  • position (coordinate of the target) –

Returns

A float containing the distance between the robot pose and the target pose.

Return type

[float]
